channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Richard Parsons, who led Time Warner and Citigroup, dies at 76
item.description: “Dick was an American original, a colossus bestriding the worlds of business, media, culture, philanthropy, and beyond,” Ronald Lauder said.

item.title: Podcast: The worst market calls of 2024, and the path for AI in 2025
U.S. stocks end mixed after Christmas break
Heading into 2025, 68% of CFOs are optimistic about the economy—but worries remain about a massive equity selloff
item.description: Finance chiefs are feeling optimistic, but a corner of the derivatives market—known colloquially as “crash protection”—may be telling a more complicat...

item.title: Why it’s hard to overstate how historically fortunate 2025’s retirees will be
7 in 10 Americans say healthcare denials and insurance company profits carry some blame in CEO’s death
item.description: Younger Americans are particularly likely to see the murder as the result of a confluence of forces rather than just one person's action.

item.title: Why 2025 looks like a great year to retire
Apple poised to cross $4 trillion threshold
item.description: Apple stock has risen 40% this year, largely on the promise of AI improvements to iPhone.

item.title: Beyoncé performance outdrew games during Netflix football foray on Christmas
Tech’s 2024 winners and losers—from Elon Musk to GM’s Cruise
item.description: Elon Musk came out on top of the tech heap in 2024.
